page.title: 06Transport in NW Derby
page.content: There are two main forms of transport through the NW sector:{rail}&{road. East of the city centre is the main London/Sheffield line, crossed by the NE/SW Newcastle/Bristol main line. North of the passenger station, St. Mary's Goods Yard ceased operation at the end of the 1970's with the change to container transport. Directly from the West to the city centre is the abandoned track of the former Great Northern Railway; no alternative land use has been found for the greater part of it. The incomplete 1930's Ring Road, the A5111, has been outgrown by traffic load, particularly NE/SW. The "Allestree Link", a major new road, now continues the A38 through Derby to link M5/M6 to M1. Important roads link Derby to other towns: A52, A6, A514, A516, A61.
